column4: F2 didn't work. caps-lock doesn't light up when I press it, so I guess the keyboard doesn't work ATM.
F2 didn't work. caps-lock doesn't light up when I press it, so I guess the keyboard doesn't work ATM.
No help to be found?

I installed Feisty a few minutes ago, totally clean install, after formatting my HDD. However, when I start my laptop, it doesnt even open Grub. After the OS boot screen, it just displays a blank screen with a blinking cursor in the top left corner, nothing else.
If I try to boot from the install cd, it does the same thing. I installed the 32 bit version.
Even if your ideas are totally out there, give it a shot, plese.

I installed Feisty a few minutes ago, totally clean install, after formatting my HDD. However, when I start my laptop, it doesnt even open Grub. After the OS boot screen, it just displays a blank screen with a blinking cursor in the top left corner, nothing else.
If I try to boot from the install cd, it does the same thing. I installed the 32 bit version.
installing in vmware?
how long have you waited for something to happen?
pay attention to who you're talking to. -- You can't boot the install CD at all now?
Ubuntu wouldn't access your BIOS settings. Do you have a floppy drive by any chance?
no, don
no, don't worry, it's just a frequent cause of the problem you describe, a non-boot floppy left in the drive ;)
can you enter your BIOS setup?
you want to check whether your BIOS is still aware of your hard disk drive.
the first being the CD-ROM drive?
have you got any USB devices attached?
your problem sounds to me like it's hardware related. I don't think it's got anything to do with your feisty installation.
coincidence.
it's just a guess, I may be wrong. Please ask the channel again, I'll keep out of it :)
leave more time between repetitions please -- give new people a chance to log on before you repeat.
are you being intentionally rude?
you've got a hardware problem, and that's that.
